poem:
"Bumblebee Supper"

On the table,
apples and honey -
Darcey debates meat while 
David mulls academia and tech.

Bumblebees buzz in her 
Inverness thoughts,
not a plate
but a conservation.

She, tasting Lib Dem freedoms,
He, cradling SNP divisions,
Under the Glasgow-Valencia sun,
a merger of two worlds

Between bites,
diverge and reconcile -
In each word,
a bumblebee's flight.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dining across the divide: ‘I think killing animals and eating them is fine. He doesn’t’ Darcey, 50, Inverness Occupation Freelance careers consultant Voting record More Lib Dem than anything else, although has voted for every party except the SNP Amuse bouche Darcey has been involved with the Bumblebee Conservation Trust for about seven years. She is obsessed with bumblebees David, 58, Glasgow and Valencia Occupation Commercial director of a technology business, PhD researcher and visiting lecturer Voting". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
